title: Autobiography and personal recollections of John B. Gough,
author: Gough, John B.
snippet: Although very weak and worn with intense suffering in body and mind, yet I will delay no longer doing that which I have ever intended as soon as practicable to do ; viz , to give a plain statement of facts relative to the unhappy circumstances in which I have been placed within the past few weeks. I left home on Monday, the 1st instant, in company with Deacon Grant of Boston, and Mr. Cyrus E. Morse; spoke in Westborough in the evening ; went the next day to Springfield,  and on the 3d, attended a convention at Blandford ; spoke three times that day ; spoke twice on the 4th, at Westfield ; took leave of Deacon Grant and lady, and left in the morning for Spring-
